name: Van der Pol oscillator
description_simple: A nonlinear oscillator with a self-sustained, stable periodic orbit known as a limit cycle.
description_complex: A deterministic second-order nonlinear dynamical system in which energy is injected and dissipated in a state-dependent manner, leading trajectories to converge to a unique stable limit cycle. In the classical parameter regime (μ ≈ 1), the system is non-chaotic, with no sensitive dependence on initial conditions and a negative largest Lyapunov exponent along the attracting cycle.
